taskDescription:
Find two equivalent finite subsets of the set of natural numbers, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mi mathvariant="double-struck">N</mi>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mo>…<!-- … --></mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\mathbb{N} = \{ 1,2,3, \ldots \}</annotation></semantics></math>, with a cardinality of 4.
